meanings.sent1: She showed her touchiness when he made a harmless joke.
meanings.sent2: His touchiness often led to unnecessary arguments.
meanings.sent3: Her touchiness about her height made her wear high heels even at home.
meanings.sent4: The cat's touchiness towards strangers was like a prickly cactus.
meanings.sent5: The touchiness of the old book's pages made them feel delicate and precious.

meanings.sent1: His touchiness made it hard to give him feedback without upsetting him.
meanings.sent2: She tried to be understanding of his touchiness about his artwork.
meanings.sent3: The touchiness of the comedian's ego was evident when he couldn't take a light-hearted joke.
meanings.sent4: The touchiness of the topic made everyone tread carefully in conversation.
meanings.sent5: The touchiness of the situation was like walking on eggshells.

meanings.definition: Tendency to react strongly or defensively
meanings.sent1: His touchiness often led to misunderstandings with his friends.
meanings.sent2: The team had to navigate around his touchiness during stressful times.
meanings.sent3: The touchiness of the situation was diffused with a bit of humor.
meanings.sent4: Her touchiness towards change was like a shield against progress.
meanings.sent5: The touchiness of the debate made it feel like a battlefield.
